channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [added] watsonx.data (lakehouse)
item.description: An open, hybrid, and governed fit-for-purpose data store optimized to scale all data, analytics and AI workloads.

item.title: [removed] Cloud for Education (education)
item.description: Cloud-based infrastructure and services for academic and research lab compute needs

item.title: [updated] Db2 Warehouse (dashdb) has removed the plan named flex-endurance-for-aws
[updated] Watson Machine Learning (pm-20) has changed the description of the plan named lite
item.description:
*before*: The lite plan instance of the IBM Watson Machine Learning service provides you with a 20 capacity unit-hours per month during which models can be trained, evaluated, deployed, and scored., *after*: CUH billing is based on CUH rate multiplied by the hours of consumption. Resource Units billing is based on the rate of the foundation model class multiplied by the number of tokens used. For details on CUH rates and foundation model classes, go to https://ibm.biz/ml-plans
1 Resource Unit = 1000 tokens

item.title: [updated] Watson Machine Learning (pm-20) has changed the description of the plan named v2-professional
item.description:
*before*: The professional plan instance of the IBM Watson Machine Learning service is billed fixed amount per month and includes 2500 capacity unit-hours. Overage is charged flat rate per each capacity unit-hour. For HIPAA support, you must enable it in your IBM Cloud account settings. For instructions, go to https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/getting-started/security.html#hipaa, *after*: CUH billing is based on CUH rate multiplied by the hours of consumption. Resource Units billing is based on the rate of the foundation model class multiplied by the number of tokens used. For details on CUH rates and foundation model classes, go to https://ibm.biz/ml-plans
1 Resource Unit = 1000 tokens
HIPAA support must be enabled in your IBM Cloud account settings. For instructions, go to https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/getting-started/security.html#hipaa

item.title: [updated] Watson Machine Learning (pm-20) has changed the description of the plan named v2-standard
item.description:
*before*: The standard plan instance of the IBM Watson Machine Learning service charges a flat rate per capacity unit-hour for models training, evaluataion, deployment, and scoring., *after*: CUH billing is based on CUH rate multiplied by the hours of consumption. Resource Units billing is based on the rate of the foundation model class multiplied by the number of tokens used. For details on CUH rates and foundation model classes, go to https://ibm.biz/ml-plans
1 Resource Unit = 1000 tokens

item.title: [updated] Bespoken Automated Testing For IVR and Chat (automated-testing-and-monitoring-for-voice-and-chat) has removed the plan named automated-testing-and-monitoring-for-voice-and-chat-trial
[updated] Watson Discovery (discovery) has removed the plan named advanced
[updated] Db2 Warehouse (dashdb) was made available in the Washington DC catalog
[updated] NeuralSeek (neuralseek) has a new plan named neuralseek-search
item.description: The Search Plan is for use cases not requiring a Virtual Agent. NeuralSeek provides a search interface to supported knowledgebases, and will provide search responses plus generative AI summaries. Any generated AI summary incurs a per-call usage fee. Cache responses are included at no additional cost. This plan's features are identical to the pay-per-answer plans EXCEPT: no export and no round-trip monitoring to a virtual agent is allowed, no sentiment scoring, and no automatic language detection (language code xx)
